meanings.definition: To become more wrinkled or creased.
meanings.sent1: After sitting on the chair for a while, the fabric started to crumplier.
meanings.sent2: She crumpliered the paper to make it easier to fit into her pocket.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy decided to crumplier the wrapping paper into a ball.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to crumplier his once smooth face, revealing the stories of his life.
meanings.sent5: The old map had crumpliered edges, showing its age and use over the years.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that crumples.
meanings.sent1: The clumsy toddler was a crumplier of papers, leaving a trail of mess behind.
meanings.sent2: She always kept a crumplier in her bag to fix any accidental folds in her documents.
meanings.sent3: The crumplier in the office was known for his ability to smooth out any creases.
meanings.sent4: The old book had become a crumplier over time, its pages worn and dog-eared.
meanings.sent5: The crumplier in the laundry room made sure all the clothes were neatly folded and stacked.
